title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 September 2016 - XWiki
content:
<Aison> has quit  
01:55 <Inge-> has quit  
01:56 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
03:04 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
03:05 <Denis> has quit  
03:15 <jonesmeier> has quit  
03:17 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
06:44 <Aison> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
07:06 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <Denis1> has quit  
09:59 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <bezourox> Hi all. tmortagne : when configuring AD, any way to check in log if connexion is OK ?  
10:07 <bezourox> because all seems configured, but auth doesn't work  
10:12 <tmortagne> bezourox: see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/#HEnableLDAPdebuglog  
10:14 <vmassol> good morning  
10:15 <vmassol> @tmortagne, mflorea, gdelhumeau, all: do we agree about standardizing on one @since per version?  
10:15 <vmassol> (I'm too lazy to send a mail and there are too many proposals these days :))  
10:15 <vmassol> (and it's not a big thing)  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> I'm not sure I understand the question  
10:15 <mflorea> I'm not convinced, I like the comma-separated list  
10:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: I answered your comment on git, did you check if javadoc supports it ?  
10:16 <Denis> I would need to know the exact consequences of this choice to have an answer  
10:17 <tmortagne> the de factor standard right now is @since 7.4.4, 8.3RC1  
10:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes javadoc supports it  
10:17 <vmassol> see http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javadoc.html#since  
10:17 <vmassol> " Multiple @since tags are allowed and are treated like multiple http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javadoc.html#author tags. You could use multiple tags if the prgram element is used by more than one API."  
10:18 <vmassol> it looks much more semantic to me to have only 1  
10:18 <tmortagne> then +1 for multiple @since tag, if they support it I guess it supposed to the standard way to have several since  
10:18 <vmassol> otherwise you need to invent a syntax which looks articificial  
10:18 <tmortagne> yes it's more semantic  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> ok so it means @since 8.1, @since 7.4 instead of @since 8.1, 7.4  
10:20 <vmassol> yes but if we don't all agree then I guess I'll have to send a mail  
10:20 <tmortagne> not really it's several lines  
10:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: even if eveyone was ok a mail would be nice for future references  
10:20 <vmassol> ok sending then, thought everyone was tired of my emails :)  
10:21 <tmortagne> one more or one less...  
10:21 <gdelhumeau> but if it's not the standard way for javadoc, I don't find if we change  
10:21 <gdelhumeau> \*mind  
10:22 <vmassol> it's the same authors gdelhumeau  
10:22 <vmassol> \*same for  
10:23 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <mflorea> I'm ok with multiple @since if it's allowed by javadoc  
10:24 <vmassol> mail sent  
10:24 <vmassol> if you could reply quickly then I could commit my changes ;)  
10:26 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <Denis> vmassol: you also mentionned that we use 8.3RC1 with caps, nice to learn, but I found this inconsistent with other usage… in Jira, maven, we have 8.3-rc-1 for example, why not being consistent then ?  
10:28 <vmassol> Denis: I know  
10:28 <vmassol> but that's what we've used from the beginning  
10:28 <vmassol> in the code  
10:29 <vmassol> note that in the RN page names we also use teh short version syntax  
10:30 <vmassol> so basically we have a mix of both short and long versions in various parts  
10:30 <Denis> and a mix of caps/non-caps  
10:30 <vmassol> FWIW changing the format in the source wouldn't affect UnstableAnnotationCheck since it only looks at the major  
10:30 <vmassol> Denis: no, AFAIK we only have 2 syntaxes  
10:30 <Denis> yep that has opposite caps, nice  
10:31 <vmassol> 8.3-rc-1 (long) or 83RC1 (short)  
10:31 <vmassol> 8.3-milestone-1, 8.3M1  
10:31 <vmassol> one is full version  
10:31 <vmassol> the other is a short version  
10:31 <bezourox> ok thanks tmortagne now I have log  
10:31 <vmassol> in the source code it wouldn't be much an issue to propose using the long version if we wanted since AFAIK there's only UnstableAnnotationCheck that potnetially uses it  
10:32 <bezourox> Caused by: com.novell.ldap.LDAPException: Invalid Credentials .... hum strange I know my credentials  
10:32 <Denis> yep, I get it, but don't be angry if I forgot that in several month, this is just not intuitive  
10:32 <vmassol> I'm not angry don't worry :) I was just poinitnig it for consistency  
10:32 <vmassol> (consistency with the rest of the code)  
10:32 <vmassol> (not consistency with jira and maven, lol)  
10:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: "but that's what we've used from the beginning", same for for coma separated versions :)  
10:33 <tmortagne> we have a lots of @since to fix  
10:34 <Denis> yep, I notice that I have applied consistency for the separator and not the caps, so I have also not been rigorous enough, I admit  
10:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep and we can change it, we just need to agree  
10:35 <tmortagne> now for the version I agree that it would make more sense to use the real form (what you call the long form)  
10:35 <tmortagne> we just been lazy  
10:35 <vmassol> yes it's faster to type 8.3M1  
10:35 <vmassol> than 8.3-milestone-1  
10:35 <vmassol> that's probably why  
10:35 <vmassol> (so laziness)  
10:36 <vmassol> @Denis: want to send a proposal?  
10:37 <tmortagne> it's easier to fix that that fixing the comma separated versions :)  
10:37 <vmassol> I wouldn't bet on that  
10:37 <vmassol> :)  
10:37 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: "Can it takes multiple arguments? For instance, we develop 4 products:  
10:37 <vmassol> contrib, rendering, platform and enterprise." I 'd like to reply but I'm not sure I understand what you mean  
10:38 <Denis> without the past, I would have been for a small caps everywhere solution, but that's not the story  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> I mean, in the macro that display the changes  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> we need to select multiple products I guess  
10:38 <tmortagne> Denis: it's not only the case  
10:38 <Denis> yep, but I am lazy :)  
10:39 <vmassol> Denis: the reason for upper M is simple it's representing something and when you use some letters to represent something you use uppercase in general  
10:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <vmassol> like AIDS and not aids  
10:39 <vmassol> like URL and not url  
10:40 <Denis> I tend to avoid those consideration when writing code in favor of singular (unless it is a list), and Title case  
10:40 <Denis> any other rule tend to make it harder  
10:40 <Denis> but, ok, lets keep like it was, we live with it for long enough  
10:40 <vmassol> BTW thomas I saw you use Xar in the xar module instead of XAR and I didn't like it since we said our convention was to use upper case (we use URL and not Url - Even Sun fixed that a long time ago by deprecating Url ;)).  
10:42 <vmassol> but I guess it would be a pain ti change now which is why I didn't comment on it, I just wish I had seen it sooner when you committed it  
10:42 <vmassol> my bad  
10:44 <bezourox> ok maybe my problem is that I want to connect to an Active Directory  
10:46 <tmortagne> bezourox: no, LDAP authentcator works well with Active Directory  
10:46 <bezourox> oh very strange.. so don't understand what's my problem...  
10:47 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/UseCases/#HActiveDirectory  
10:47 <bezourox> telnet on AD server on port 389 answer me without problem  
10:47 <tmortagne> it's probably the most used LDAP server with XWiki  
10:47 <tmortagne> you said the error was about credential  
10:48 <tmortagne> nothing to do with connection  
10:48 <tmortagne> XWiki connect well too  
10:48 <tmortagne> but you did not gave it the right user/pass  
10:50 <bezourox> I did same config like you : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Application/  
10:51 <bezourox> don't define any group, maybe the proble...  
10:51 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's "Xar" because it follows Java standard "Zip" APIs  
10:51 <tmortagne> bezourox: you don't need to define any group  
10:51 <tmortagne> your error is way before using any group  
10:52 <tmortagne> your issue is with bind DN and bind password  
10:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: ZIPFileAssertComparator ;) (this one has ZIP in upperase which is niuce ;))  
10:53 <tmortagne> bezourox: is the bind DN you are using have the form "uid\domain" ?  
10:54 <vmassol> XAR is closer to WAR, EAR, RAR  
10:54 <vmassol> even ZIP is used in uppercase  
10:54 <vmassol> anyway  
10:55 <vmassol> don't want to spend too much on this ;)  
10:55 <tmortagne> vmassol: I'm not debating with you I'm explaining where the name come from  
10:55 <vmassol> ok  
11:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> hi there guys, is there any way to define a document tree macro in a template that gets the child pages of the page that it's defined in?  
11:05 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has quit  
11:11 <bezourox> tmortagne: in log file ?  
11:12 <tmortagne> bezourox: in your configuration but yes you should see it in the oog  
11:12 <tmortagne> log  
11:12 <tmortagne> the log tells you which bind DN was used to connect  
11:12 <bezourox> from xwiki GUI, i'm testing with my accourt "toto"  
11:13 <bezourox> in log file : Binding to LDAP server with credentials login=[cn=toto] 2016-09-20 10:48:41,652 [http://vmdevlinux:8080/xwiki/bin/loginsubmit/XWiki/XWikiLogin] DEBUG x.c.l.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl - Local LDAP authentication failed.  
11:17 <bezourox> seems to note use base DN I defined befaure  
11:17 <bezourox> dc=HOME,dc=local  
11:17 <tmortagne> bezourox: cn=toto is definitely not a proper bind dn  
11:18 <tmortagne> in there you should have either a complete DN or a AD style "toto\domain" bind dn  
11:18 <tmortagne> base DN is for search  
11:24 <Aison> when I start my xwiki, maven tries to fetch some files. Is it possible to disable that somehow for use on an offline server?  
11:26 <Aison> ok, maybe it is not maven  
11:26 <Aison> But I get Unexepcted error when trying to find extension...  
11:27 <vmassol> yes xwiki contacts extensions.xwiki.org  
11:27 <vmassol> basically the extension repo defined in xwiki.properties  
11:27 <vmassol> s/repo/repos  
11:28 <vmassol> I guess you could uncomment just the local maven repo as that would override the default repos  
11:28 <Aison> vmassol, xwiki.conf?  
11:28 <tmortagne> Aison: xwiki.properties  
11:29 <tmortagne> #-# To not have any repository enabled (including disabling default repositories) you can explicitly make this list empty:  
11:45 <Aison> thx  
11:46 <bezourox> tmortagne: base DN is for search I understand, so dc=HOME,dc=local seems to be good  
11:50 <Aison> where can I set the default wiki? currently / goes into Main  
11:51 <Aison> is that structs-config.xml  
11:51 <Aison> ?  
11:52 <Aison> ah, web.xml  
11:58 <Aison> what is the reason for this strange error? Failed to retrieve extension data. Failed  
11:58 <Aison> I get this when I try to uninstall or install an extension  
12:00 <tmortagne> Aison: will need a more detailed error  
12:00 <Aison> how can I get that? That's all what I get on the frontend. xwiki 8.1  
12:00 <tmortagne> where do you get that error ?  
12:01 <tmortagne> if it's extension manager UI then click on the error and you should get details  
12:02 <Aison> yes, in the extension manager UI  
12:02 <Aison> when I click on the error it directly disappears  
12:04 <Aison> oh, bbl :( i'm back soon  
12:08 <tmortagne> Aison: wait, didn't you disabled extension repositories ?  
12:09 <Aison> has quit  
12:21 <bezourox> I will begin goat  
12:28 <bezourox> tmortagne: AD LDS must be installed on AD server ?  
12:36 <bezourox> The provided user is null. We don't try to authenticate, it probably means the user is in non logged mode.  
12:49 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <vmassol1> for ex if you search for http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SolrSearch?sort=score&sortOrder=desc&highlight=true&facet=true&r=1&f\_type=DOCUMENT&f\_locale=en&f\_locale=&text=document+macro you get results from curriki subwiki  
12:49 <vmassol> has quit  
13:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> has quit  
13:07 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
13:08 <Aison> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <Aison> back  
13:39 <edvorg> has quit  
13:40 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
13:46 <Aison> ok, back to my question: When I try to install or uninstall an extension in the extension manager ui, I get the error  
13:47 <Aison> Failed to retrieve extension data. Found  
13:47 <Aison> When I click this message, it directly disappears.  
13:47 <Aison> Is there a way to read the error message elsewhere?  
13:49 <bezourox> tmortagne: do I have to create an AD group or other in relation with XWIKI on my AD serv ?  
13:57 <tmortagne> bezourox: I never had to setup the AD side but I don't think you need anything special  
13:58 <bezourox> I found a setup tu test the connexion and seems to be good  
13:58 <tmortagne> the minimum is just a user that can bind to AD trough LDAP protocol but maybe it's possible to disable LDAP access in AD I don't know  
13:58 <bezourox> with this programm I can retrieve users informations  
13:58 <tmortagne> so that should be OK I guess  
14:00 <tmortagne>   Restarting xwiki.org  
14:13 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <vmassol> ok thates the good one  
14:13 <vmassol> clever bot  
14:13 <vmassol> :)  
14:13 <vmassol> automaitcally reconnects when it can  
14:13 <vmassol> been trying to connect and couldn't due to denis' one which has connected before it  
14:14 <vmassol> s/has/had  
14:15 <vmassol> mflorea: normally all \*Config page are supposed to be modifiable by users  
14:15 <vmassol> but ok  
14:15 <vmassol> doing as you suggest for now  
14:16 <vmassol> BTW in my apps I don't provide a \*Config page and I generate it the first time  
14:16 <vmassol> so that users can change it  
14:16 <vmassol> thereafter  
14:17 <vmassol> (and Main.SolrSearch is not supposed to be modified by the user)  
14:19 <mflorea> yes, it  
14:19 <mflorea> it's not perfect  
14:22 <vmassol> mflorea: where does $wikisSearchableFromMainWiki come from in Main.SolrSearchConfig? defined in the code?  
14:22 <vmassol> checking code  
14:23 <mflorea> no where, it just allows you to define this variable before including the config  
14:23 <vmassol> so it's going to resolve to "$wikisSearchableFromMainWiki"  
14:23 <vmassol> since there's no !  
14:23 <vmassol> "!"  
14:23 <vmassol> $!wikisSearchableFromMainWiki  
14:23 <vmassol> vs $wikisSearchableFromMainWiki  
14:24 <mflorea> I don't see any quotes  
14:24 <mflorea> 'wikisSearchableFromMainWiki': $wikisSearchableFromMainWiki,  
14:24 <vmassol> if the var doesn't exist velocity doesn't resolve it  
14:24 <mflorea> it will simply be null  
14:24 <mflorea> where do you see the quotes?  
14:25 <vmassol> ok so it'll be null in the map  
14:25 <mflorea> yep  
14:25 <tmortagne> Velocity does resolve it but the result of anything that produce null is printed as the source  
14:25 <tmortagne> but that's only a print rule  
14:26 <vmassol> yes ok  
14:26 <vmassol> thx  
14:28 <vmassol> ok search is fixed on xwiki.org  
14:33 <vmassol> evalica/all: do we have a css style for having xproperties take the whole horizontal space in edit mode?  
14:33 <vmassol> $doc.display('xxx')  
14:34 <vmassol> (in edit mode)  
14:34 <vmassol> seems the blog app uses its own custom style unfortunately  
14:34 <vmassol> (I'm referring to input type = text )  
14:34 <vmassol> I'd prefer not to have to introduce a ssx if I can avoid it  
14:35 <vmassol> so a class would be nice  
14:35 <vmassol> (an exisint class that is)  
14:35 <evalica> vmassol: no, vertical space is very hard to achieve  
14:35 <vmassol> horizontal  
14:35 <evalica> horizontal? col-xs-12 ?  
14:36 <vmassol> "evalica/all: do we have a css style for having xproperties take the whole horizontal space in edit mode?" yes horizontal  
14:36 <vmassol> ok trying that  
14:36 <evalica> might need to put to parent  
14:37 <evalica> if the input is in a .xform it has width:100%  
14:37 <evalica> so having the parent as .xform might also suffice  
14:37 <vmassol> I don't control the form  
14:37 <vmassol> it's gneerated by the edit mode  
14:37 <vmassol> all I do is write $doc.display()  
14:38 <evalica> so try adding .xform or .col-xs-12 to the parent  
14:38 <vmassol> you mean I should introduce a <div>  
14:38 <evalica> yes, before the display  
14:38 <vmassol> which will be inside the <form>  
14:42 <vmassol> ok so the issue is that style.css from the skin has width:auto  
14:42 <vmassol> I'll override  
14:43 <vmassol> hmm no  
14:43 <vmassol> ok let's forget it  
14:43 <vmassol> I don't want to add css to my code  
14:45 <vmassol> ok so the default in our forms.less.vm is width:auto  
14:45 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/dcd85167489885e2017e4c56f6a4768924542927/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-flamingo/xwiki-platform-flamingo-skin/xwiki-platform-flamingo-skin-resources/src/main/resources/flamingo/less/forms.less#L9-L9  
14:52 <bezourox> tmortagne: my log file is :  
14:52 <bezourox>  The provided user is null. We don't try to authenticate, it probably means the user is in non logged mode.  
14:52 <bezourox> XWikiUser: null  
14:53 <tmortagne> bezourox: don't worry about this, you get this when you access the XWiki anonymously  
14:53 <tmortagne> then you login  
14:54 <bezourox> that' my 2 last line in logfile after login fail  
14:55 <bezourox> when I read this part : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/UseCases/#HActiveDirectory  
14:55 <bezourox> ldap\_bind\_DN: domain{0}  
14:55 <bezourox> strange  
14:55 <bezourox> domain\{0} give me domain\\user  
14:56 <bezourox> not a problem with double slash  
14:58 <vmassol> going to import the first version of the release notes app on xwiki.org.  
15:05 <sputnikk23\_cylon> has joined #xwiki  
15:05 <sputnikk23\_cylon> hi all. how does one enable other syntaxes in xwiki 8.1? I just installed the markdown extension and don't see it in the available syntaxes list  
15:09 <bezourox> tmortagne: ok now it's work..  
15:10 <bezourox> many exemple with xwiki.authentication.ldap.bind\_DN=subdomain\\{0}  
15:10 <bezourox> or xwiki.authentication.ldap.bind\_DN=subdomain{0}  
15:15 <vmassol> hmm I think I've found a bug  
15:15 <vmassol> ah no  
15:15 <vmassol> just a limitation  
15:18 <vmassol> do we ahve a jira issue for renaming xobjects when renaming a page with a class definition?  
15:27 <sputnikk23\_cylon> has quit  
15:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes renaming a class is not a good idea right now :)  
15:35 <vmassol> ok creating jira  
15:38 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13721  
15:41 <msmeria> has quit  
15:49 <vmassol> I now have to convert 12 pages ....  
15:49 <vmassol> I'll have to write a script...  
15:50 <vmassol> too bad, couldn't find an existing snippet for that  
15:54 <bezourox> tmortagne: for xwiki, nothing change in this part : ldap\_fields\_mapping: name=sAMAccountName,last\_name=sn,first\_name=givenName,fullname=displayName,email=mail,ldap\_dn=dn ?  
15:54 <bezourox> because I tested and maping doesn't work  
16:02 <edvorg> has quit  
16:03 <evalica> vmassol: normal users should be able to edit playground pages. Currently, as normal user, I cannot edit Sandbox space for example. do you know something about it?  
16:06 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <vmassol> whatttttt! big bug :)  
16:06 <vmassol> it's the opposite normally  
16:06 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: have you set back the permissions?  
16:07 <vmassol> (part of step 7 on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Migrations/ )  
16:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: not sure what you mean by "set back", I did not changed the rights  
16:09 <vmassol> see step 7 thomas  
16:09 <tmortagne> I know this step but again I did not changed the rights  
16:09 <vmassol> so they're not correct I guess  
16:09 <tmortagne> so the were wrong before the upgrade  
16:09 <vmassol> could you ceheck?  
16:09 <vmassol> the template is locked  
16:09 <vmassol> so that users cannot change it  
16:10 <vmassol> if you copy it then you copy the permissions  
16:10 <vmassol> the locked one  
16:11 <evalica> looking at the recording apparently the right was not set even before the upgrade, on the 7.4.2 … so playground is not editable for a longer time  
16:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: note that there is a big issue in the /root/playground/clean.sh logic because the cache won't be in sync with the database after it's executed  
16:14 <evalica> no .. I take it back.. it has editt right on 7.4.2 on 01/09  
16:14 <tmortagne> anyway the sql file should be ok now  
16:14 <tmortagne> evalica: where are you looking  
16:14 <tmortagne> ?  
16:15 <evalica> mouseflow  
16:15 <evalica> recordings  
16:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <Aison> has quit
